articles.title: Joint air defense drill projected in S. Korea
articles.content:
Joint air defense drill projected in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- South Korean hawks reportedly announced on March 12 that there would be a joint air defense drill in 42 towns throughout South Korea on March 15, including Seoul and Pusan.   They plan to let F-4E fighter planes, called imaginary "enemy planes" fly over the "National Assembly building," Songsu Bridge and other parts of Seoul to create an atmosphere of war.   Similar military exercises reminiscent of an actual war are to be held in other cities, too.

articles.title: Japan-S. Korea military tie-up tightened
articles.content:
Japan-S. Korea military tie-up tightened
    Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Military officials of Japan and South Korea reportedly decided to set in motion an emergency liaison network in July at the earliest for information exchange.   Pursuant to the decision 3 liaison channels will be installed through telephone and fax.   Both sides plan to set up a hotline between the top military brasses following the establishment of the emergency network.   They also confirmed a plan to stage joint "search and rescue" maneuvers in East Sea of Korea around July.   All this proves that Japanese and South Korean authorities put spurs to preparations for an anti-DPRK war.

articles.title: Humiliating sycophantic treachery
articles.content:
Humiliating sycophantic treachery
    Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- A "bill on an agreement on defense cost sharing for the U.S. forces in South Korea" was railroaded through the South Korean "National Assembly" on March 8, a Seoul-based radio said.   The South Korean authorities decided to offer 339 million dollars to the U.S. forces as "defense cost sharing" for this year.   Those dastardly flunkeyist traitors pay a colossal amount of money for the upkeep of the U.S. forces every year.
